job_description: Project Officer Livelihood and Agriculture : Uttaran Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Uttaran Project Officer Livelihood and Agriculture Application Deadline : 10 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Location: Bagerhat (Morrelganj) Salary: Tk. 44100 (Monthly) Published: 02 Feb 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Women candidates are highly encouraged to apply. Experience Minimum 5 years of experience Proven experience in program planning, implementation, budgeting, financial management, staff management, and report writing. Experience in working with government departments Experience in delivering training for a variety of state and non-state actor audiences (local NGOs, government authorities, etc.) Skills and Competencies: Strong technical knowledge of agriculture and livelihood. Proven experience in organizing and facilitating training programs. Expertise in climate-resilient agriculture and nutrition-sensitive farming. Excellent communication and networking skills. Strong documentation and report-writing abilities. Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders. Strong decisions making ability and motivational skill especially with rural communities Strong management skills including the ability to provide strategic guidance, technical oversight, mentor staff, build strong teams, develop work plans, and manage budgets and project expenditures Excellent communication and report-writing skills in English Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other computer skills Responsibilities & Context Job Context Uttaran is a national development organization working in the coastal region of Bangladesh since 1985 to uphold rights and entitlements and to improve the socio-economic condition of the poor and disadvantaged. Uttaran facilitates in getting access to and control over resources by the poor and disadvantaged to improve agricultural productivity and economic empowerment. Uttaran with the help of HELVETAS Swiss Interco operation Bangladesh will collaborate to implement the Actions to Climate Change Ensuring Sustainable Solutions (ACCESS) programme in the southwestern region of Bangladesh. This partnership aims to enhance capacities in adaptation, disaster risk management, climate-induced migration, water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH), livelihood, soil, and food security through mutual capacity strengthening programs and knowledge-sharing activities. Together, they will explore, pilot, and disseminate innovative technologies and methodologies while engaging in advocacy efforts to promote their adoption. Uttaran invites applications for the vacant position titled- Project Officer Livelihood and Agriculture for the Actions to Climate Change

To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 35 to 45 years Responsibilities & Context Plan, study, and collect financial and operational data to determine the costs of business activities, including raw and finished material purchases, inventory management, and labor costs. Analyze collected financial data and accurately record results in accounting books and systems. Supervise day-to-day financial transactions, review and analyze all entries, and ensure proper posting in accounting software. Prepare monthly financial statements, including Profit & Loss Accounts and Balance Sheets. Prepare project-wise costing reports and project-specific Profit & Loss statements. Prepare and maintain Accounts Receivable (AR) and Accounts Payable (AP) schedules, ensuring timely follow-up and healthy cash flow. Organize and process vendor payments in compliance with company policies and approval procedures. Supervise payroll preparation and payment processes. Analyze actual service and manufacturing costs and prepare periodic variance reports by comparing standard costs with actual costs. Record and maintain cost information to support effective cost control and expenditure management. Analyze cost audit findings and prepare detailed reports for management review. Prepare cost estimates for new and proposed products or services. Provide management with analytical reports highlighting factors affecting pricing, cost efficiency, and profitability of products or services. Maintain and continuously improve the cost accounting system to ensure accuracy and reliability. Prepare depreciation schedules for fixed assets and ensure proper accounting treatment. Monitor and follow up on capital expenditures to ensure compliance with approved budgets and justifications. Ensure effective control over inventory, credit and collections, disbursements, deposits, and remittances. Enforce proper documentation and establish adequate internal controls over revenues, expenses, and asset protection. Assist in the month-end closing of the general ledger and reconciliation of accounts. Prepare and present financial data and reports for weekly Management Committee meetings. Maintain positive working relationships with subordinates and cross-functional teams to ensure smooth operations. Perform any other duties as assigned from time to time to support organizational objectives. Skills & Expertise

Experience in: Manufacturing or export-oriented companies an asset but not mandatory Banking, LC handling, and working capital cycles Tax, VAT, and statutory compliance Exposure to audits, ERP systems, and senior management reporting. Hard Skills: Financial Accounting & GL Control AP / AR Management Treasury Operations & Cash Forecasting Bank & LC Accounting Tax, VAT & Withholding Compliance Budgeting & Variance Analysis Internal Control Design ERP Systems & Advanced Excel Financial Reporting & Analysis Audit & Regulatory Coordination Soft Skills High integrity, ethics, and confidentiality Strategic thinking with operational depth Strong leadership and decision-making ability Excellent communication with CFO, banks, auditors, and management Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines Risk awareness and control mindset Ownership mentality and accountability Coachability and long-term leadership potential Responsibilities & Context Overview The Financial Accountant is the senior operational finance leader responsible for end-to-end financial control, accounting operations, treasury management, compliance, and management reporting of the organization. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), the Financial Accountant ensures financial accuracy, regulatory compliance, cash flow stability, and internal control integrity, while progressively developing the skills, judgment, and leadership required to excel in a high-level leadership role. Key Responsibilities 1. Financial Control & Accounting Leadership Lead and oversee all functions of the Financial Control & Accounting sub-department. job_description: RTK Surveyor : Environment and Infrastructure Management Solution Limited (EIMS) Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Environment and Infrastructure Management Solution Limited (EIMS) RTK Surveyor Application Deadline : 10 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Company Information Summary Vacancy: -- Location: Anywhere in Bangladesh Published: 27 Jan 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Experience: At least 8 to 10 to years of hands-on experience in RTK/Total Station survey, GIS and Auto cad operation. Other Requirements: Expert in operating Total Station and Differential Global Positioning System (DGPS) with Real-Time Kinematics (RTK). Previous experience in surveying river sections, embankments, khals (canals), and other hydrological surveys. Preference will be given to candidates proficient in GIS & AutoCAD for generating digital reports and drawings. Excellent written and oral communication skill Skilled in using digital tools for real-time data collection and transferring survey data. Efficiently handles multiple tasks and field challenges. Responsibilities & Context Conduct and supervise topographic surveys, including cross and long section surveys of khals and embankments. Direct experience in LLC financial management and compliance is mandatory. Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in ERP systems (SAP/Oracle/Xero) and high-level Excel modeling. Language: Native-level fluency in English. Proficiency in Bangla is a mandatory asset for coordinating with our South Asian trade partners. Mindset: A "Foundational Member" spirit, you must be highly organized, ethically unassailable, and ready to contribute to a growing institution. Responsibilities & Context Corporate Accountant (Foundational Team) Company: SD Cargo Services SDN BHD Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia Sector: Global Logistics & Strategic Freight THE INSTITUTION SD Group Malaysia is a multi-sector operations and investment group bridging the gap between global standards and local excellence. Through our flagship logistics arm, SD Cargo Services SDN BHD , and our strategic alliance with COSCO Shipping Lines , we are establishing a high-tech, 5-star standard in the ASEAN-South Asia trade corridor. We are currently seeking a meticulous and high-performing Corporate Accountant to join our core team, who will define the financial integrity and growth of our Malaysian operations. THE ROLE As a Corporate Accountant for SD Cargo Services, you will manage the financial heartbeat of a global logistics operation. This role requires a professional who thrives in multi-currency environments, understands the complexities of international trade finance, and maintains the 5-star precision that defines the SD Group brand. Key Responsibilities: Financial Management: Oversee all accounts, ledgers, and reporting systems, ensuring compliance with Malaysian Financial Reporting Standards (MFRS), IFRS, and LLC-specific accounting principles . LLC Entity Handling: Manage the financial structure and compliance of Limited Liability Company (LLC) entities within the group, ensuring proper documentation of liability protections and inter-company shielding. Trade Finance: Manage multi-currency transactions (MYR, USD, BDT) and international wire transfers related to our strategic fleet operations and COSCO alliance. Cost Analysis: Monitor and analyze freight costs, customs duties, and operational expenses to optimize the Malaysia-Bangladesh trade route. Tax & Compliance: Handle SST (Sales and Service Tax) filings in Malaysia and ensure seamless coordination with LLC tax rep

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects. Proficiency in MS Office and technical documentation. Responsibilities & Context Plan, organize, and lead all Research & Development activities related to garment washing, dyeing effects, and finishing processes. Develop new washing techniques, recipes, and value-added finishes in line with buyer requirements and fashion trends. Conduct laboratory and bulk trials to improve fabric appearance, hand feel, durability, and performance. Coordinate with production, merchandising, quality assurance, and compliance teams to ensure smooth implementation of R&D developments. Evaluate and approve chemicals, enzymes, and auxiliaries; ensure proper usage and cost optimization. Analyze wash performance issues (shade variation, strength loss, pilling, color fastness, etc.) and provide corrective actions. Lead continuous improvement initiatives to reduce reprocessing, wastage, water, energy, and chemical consumption. Ensure all R&D activities comply with buyer standards, ZDHC, RSL/MRSL, and local environmental regulations. Monitor and implement sustainable and eco-friendly washing technologies and processes. Prepare and maintain technical documents including SOPs, wash recipes, trial reports, and cost breakdowns. Support sampling, pilot runs, and pre-production approvals to ensure right-first-time production. Provide technical support during production challenges and buyer audits. Train and develop R&D, lab, and technical staff to enhance skills and performance. Liaise with machinery and chemical suppliers to evaluate new technologies and improvements. Maintain R&D lab equipment, testing instruments, and ensure proper calibration. Review customer feedback and production data to drive innovation and performance improvement. Lead root cause analysis (RCA) and corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) for technical non-conformities. Prepare monthly and annual R&D performance reports for management review. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Experience: 2‚Äì5 years in solar PV system design or renewable energy engineering. Technical Skills: Proficiency in PV system design tools (AutoCAD, PVsyst, Helioscope, SketchUp, Revit). Knowledge of solar PV system components, grid interconnection, and energy storage, IPP project. Understanding of local and international electrical standards and codes. Soft Skills: Analytical and problem-solving skills. Effective communication and collaboration abilities. Attention to detail and ability to work under deadlines. Other Requirements: Willingness to travel to project sites for surveys and commissioning support. Enthusiasm for renewable energy technologies and continuous learning. Responsibilities & Context Job Purpose The Design & Technical Solution / Project Development Engineer is responsible for preparing, reviewing, and supporting the design and technical aspects of solar PV projects. The role ensures accurate system designs, technical proposals, and feasibility assessments to support project development and execution. Department: Engineering & Project Development Location: Dhaka (with site visits as required) Reports To: Technical Solution Manager Roles and Responsibilities System Design & Technical Support Prepare conceptual, preliminary, and detailed designs for solar PV systems (rooftop, ground-mounted, hybrid). Conduct site surveys and analyze site constraints to inform design decisions. Assist in preparing single-line diagrams, layouts, and structural designs. Technical Proposal & Project Development Support Support business development teams in preparing technical proposals and feasibility studies. Perform energy yield assessments, shading analysis, and simulation studies. Contribute to the development of project documentation, specifications, and Bill of Materials (BOM). Quality Assurance & Compliance Ensure designs comply with local regulations and international standards (IEC, IEEE, NEC, etc.). Perform design reviews and provide technical inputs for risk assessments. Assist in reviewing vendor submittals and equipment datasheets for compliance. Project Execution Assistance Provide technical support to project implementation teams during installation, testing, and commissioning. Review as-built drawings and assist in documentation of design changes. Collaborate with procurement and O&M teams to ensure proper technical execution. Continuous Improvement &

Quality Control Manager : Unifa Handbag & Belt (BD) Co.Ltd. Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List Unifa Handbag & Belt (BD) Co.Ltd. Quality Control Manager Application Deadline : 10 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Skills & Expertise Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Age: 35 to 50 years Location: Gazipur (Gazipur Sadar) Salary: Negotiable Published: 11 Jan 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 35 to 50 years Responsibilities & Context Quality Management System and Standard Development: Develop and refine inspection standards, work instructions, and quality control procedures for various products based on customer requirements. Establish and maintain inspection criteria and standards for raw materials, auxiliary materials, hardware, finished products, and all stages of production, including warehousing. Periodically review and update quality control procedures to ensure their applicability and effectiveness. Supplier and Incoming Material Quality Control: Assist the procurement department in conducting quality assessments and qualification reviews for new suppliers of fabrics, auxiliary materials, hardware, etc. Perform Incoming Quality Control (IQC) inspections on raw materials and auxiliary materials to ensure quality control at the source. Identify, isolate, and handle non-conforming items. Production Process Quality Monitoring: Pre-production Quality Control: Organize pre-production meetings to communicate quality standards and key control points to the production department. Conduct strict inspection and confirmation of the first-piece product to resolve issues before bulk production. During Production Inspection (DUPRO): Perform online and offline sampling inspections when 20%-30% of production is completed. Promptly identify deviations in workmanship, dimensions, color, functionality, etc., during the production process and drive immediate corrective actions to prevent batch quality issues. Final Random Inspection (FRI): When all products for an order are produced and at least 80% are packaged, conduct final random sampling inspections according to AQL standards. Generate detailed inspection reports as a key basis for shipment authorization. Client Inspection and Relationship Maintenance: Lead and accompany third-party inspection companies or client representatives during product inspections. Prepare necessary documents, samples, and production records in advance to ensure a smooth inspection process. Swiftly organize relevant departments to analyze root causes, develop corrective and preventive actions for issues raised in inspection reports, and follow up until issues are closed. Team Management and Data Analysis: Manage daily operations of the QC team, including work assignments, skills training, and performance evaluations

Responsibilities & Context Job Context: International Medicare Limited (IML) is playing a pioneering role in the health sector of Bangladesh by providing quality medical education and healthcare services. The mission of International Medicare Limited (IML) is to advance healthcare services, human resource development and the overall health of the communities. We are looking for a Deputy General Manager (DGM) for our Administration Division, who will lead and inspire the team, driving continuous improvement and operational excellence. Job Responsibilities: Support daily administrative operations of International Medicare Limited (IML) and its sister concern (Medical College, Hospital, Nursing College, Health Technology Unit & Diagnostic Centre). Implement and enforce institutional policies and procedures. Facilitate staff recruitment, training, and performance evaluations. Coordinate between academic and medical departments for smooth operations. Oversee patient services, admission, and billing processes. Ensure legal and regulatory compliance for IML and its sister concern activities. Implement quality assurance and risk management programs. Plan for institutional growth, expansions, and technological advancements. Liaise with government authorities, stakeholders, and external partners. job_description: Senior Executive - Supply Chain Management (Elevator Business) : AG Industrial Solutions Limited Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List AG Industrial Solutions Limited Senior Executive - Supply Chain Management (Elevator Business) Application Deadline : 10 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 1 Location: Dhaka Salary: Negotiable Published: 27 Jan 2026 To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Responsibilities & Context Local Purchase & Procurement Execute local procurement of elevator-related materials, accessories, consumables, and civil items. Collect quotations, prepare comparative statements (CS), and support price negotiation. Issue Purchase Orders (POs) and ensure compliance with company procurement policy. Coordinate with site, engineering, and project teams for material requirements. Track delivery schedules and ensure timely supply to project sites. Maintain proper documentation (PO, GRN, invoices, vendor files). Installation Vendor Sourcing & Management Identify, evaluate, and enlist elevator installation vendors and subcontractors. Conduct commercial negotiation and finalize installation rates as per project scope. Coordinate work orders, mobilization, and site readiness with vendors. Monitor vendor performance on safety, quality, and installation timelines. Resolve installation-related supply or coordination issues. Maintain an updated database of approved installation vendors. Coordinate site-wise civil work schedules with project and installation teams. Monitor vendor billing, certification, and payment documentation. Ensure civil works align with elevator installation requirements. Cost Control & Coordination Support budget control by negotiating competitive rates and avoiding cost overruns. Coordinate closely with Projects, Finance, and Engineering teams. Assist in forecasting procurement needs based on project progress. Ensure compliance with safety, contractual, and company policies. Review patient history, investigations, and treatment plans regularly. Critical Care Management: Manage critically ill patients including hemodynamic instability, sepsis, electrolyte imbalance, respiratory distress, and altered consciousness. Initiate and monitor emergency life-saving measures as per protocol. Coordinate with consultants for advanced critical care decision-making and referrals. Emergency Management: Handle medical emergencies including cardiac arrest, shock, hypertensive crisis, hypoglycemia, acute pulmonary edema, and dialysis-related emergencies. Lead and participate in CPR and emergency response activities as per hospital guidelines. Ensure timely stabilization and referral of emergency patients when required. Dialysis Center Responsibilities: Supervise dialysis procedures in coordination with nephrologists and nursing staff. Manage dialysis-related complications such as hypotension, cramps, bleeding, access-related issues, and allergic reactions. Ensure compliance with infection prevention and control standards in the dialysis unit. Supervision & Team Coordination: Supervise Junior RMOs, nurses, PCA, and other support staff. Ensure proper duty roster implementation

Website: https://goldstargroupbd.com/ Business: Goldstar Group, is a 100% Export Oriented Readymade Garments Company, came into being in the year 1992. Under Goldstar Group, we have 5 garments production units, Washing plant with multiple wash facility, C&F, Logistics together with a vertical setup of Carton, Polybag and accessories manufacturing plant. We had started our journey with 4(four) lines initially and now over a period of 30 years, the company has matured to 50 lines with 65 machines each. Through a wide range of products and services, the company has earned the goodwill of many reputed brands from across the globe. Producing over 25 million pieces of garments per year, it is now among the largest vendors in Bangladesh for Lidl , Aldi, Costco, Promtex and Wal-Mart with annual turnover of over 70 million US Dollars. The company has consistently excelled with a strong performance record of substantial annual growth over the last two decade and has earned several awards and recognitions from number of importers and brands. job_description: Specialist - Human Resources, General Affairs (Admin) & Accounting : New Vision Solutions Ltd Jobs ENG ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ Create Account Sign In For Employer Create Sign In Home Jobs Mybdjobs Job List New Vision Solutions Ltd Specialist - Human Resources, General Affairs (Admin) & Accounting Application Deadline : 10 Feb 2026 Apply Now Shortlist Share: Facebook LinkedIn WhatsApp All Requirements Responsibilities Salary & Benefits Company Information Summary Vacancy: 2 Age: 30 to 36 years Location: Dhaka (Banani) Salary: Tk. 60000 - 100000 (Monthly) Published: 22 Jan 2026 Applicants are encouraged to submit Video CV. To access Application Insights Get Bdjobs Pro Requirements Education Experience Additional Requirements Age 30 to 36 years Professional: 5 - 8 years of experience. Business-level English (Japanese proficiency is highly valued and compensated accordingly). Proficiency in basic PC operations (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Internet, AI related). Experience in Japanese or International Companies. Preference for candidates with experience in office start-up phases. Strong communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with international colleagues. Demonstrates leadership and teamwork, with a commitment to prioritizing the needs of others. Long-term commitment to the company, with the ability to contribute over an extended period. Flexible and proactive in responding to urgent or unexpected situations and tasks. Responsibilities & Context Job Context We are hiring a dedicated and experienced individual to manage General Affairs (Administration), Human Resources, and Accounting tasks at the Japanese Multinational Company. Key Responsibilities 1. General Affairs and Human Resources: Look after the recruitment & selection process. Manage attendance records and ensure compliance with labor and social insurance requirements. Oversea labor management and office equipment operations. Maintain and update work regulations / HR Policies. Handle expatriate visa processes, work permits, bank account openings, and accommodation arrangements. Coordinate travel arrangements for business travelers, including flights, hotels, and transportation. Manage contracts with subcontractors. Other General affairs and HR related tasks. 2. Accounting Support: Process expense payments and maintain bookkeeping records. Calculate and distribute payroll. Assist with accounting tasks and support audits. Communicate with external accounting firms and partners. Other Accounting Related tasks Local and consolidated accounting, tax matters will be outsourced to an external accounting firm. Responsibilities & Context Job Summary We are seeking an experienced and responsible factory-based Garments Merchandiser with strong communication and coordination skills to manage orders from inquiry to final delivery. The role requires close coordination with buyers, China teams, factories, and logistics to ensure timely production, quality compliance, and cost control. Probation period: 3‚Äì6 months. Key Responsibilities Manage the entire order lifecycle , from customer inquiry, order confirmation, production follow-up, shipment, to after-sales feedback. Coordinate with China teams, factories, and logistics partners to ensure clear understanding of product specifications, quality standards, packaging requirements, and delivery timelines. Monitor raw material status including fabrics, trims, and accessories to ensure timely delivery to factories. Address and resolve material shortages, delays, or quality issues promptly. Prepare and submit regular progress reports to internal management covering production status, quality updates, and potential risks. Handle all merchandising documentation , including contracts, inspection reports, shipping documents, and proper record keeping. Provide professional input on production feasibility, factory capacity, and cost optimization based on operational experience. Support smooth communication between buyers and production teams to ensure customer satisfaction.
